Sentencas: This work demonstrates the potential of two recently developed plasma spray methods to deposit Sr-doped La-(Mn,Fe.Co) perovskite (LSM, LSF, LSCF) cathodes, and yttria-doped zirconia (YSZ) electrolytes as components of solid oxide fuel cells (SOFC).
Titulo: Thermal induction plasma processes for the synthesis of SOFC materials

Sentencas: These methods are Thermal Plasma Chemical Vapour Deposition (TPCVD) and Suspension Plasma Spraying (SPS).
Titulo: Thermal induction plasma processes for the synthesis of SOFC materials

Sentencas: The microstructure obtained is determined by the method applied.
Titulo: Thermal induction plasma processes for the synthesis of SOFC materials

Sentencas: TPCVD results in either globular or columnar coatings which were deposited with growth rates up to 30 mum/min. SPS with a deposition rate in excess of 100 mum/min yields coatings of layered microstructure.
Titulo: Thermal induction plasma processes for the synthesis of SOFC materials

Sentencas: The homogeneity of the dopant distribution and the phase purity of YSZ is excellent.
Titulo: Thermal induction plasma processes for the synthesis of SOFC materials

Sentencas: Process modifications will be necessary, however, to improve the properties in the case of perovskite coatings.
Titulo: Thermal induction plasma processes for the synthesis of SOFC materials
